column4: I ask becuase installing gnome to my old kde-suse only lead to trouble
But that requires the programs to respect my choice :P
I'm planning to switch to KDE and may aswell reinstall as it's fresh anyway, I'm just wondering if I should try Debian

I just got back  here, but if you want to install KDE, just do "sudo aptitude install kubuntu-desktop"
thanks, I'll get right on that
you may need to apply changes to your NTFS before you can resize the Ext3.
you have to apply the changes first.
